stages.title: Define Your Mechanical Engineering Path
stages.description: Clarify your specialization interests, target universities, and how mechanical engineering aligns with your career goals.

Global.overview: Top mechanical engineering programs value strong math/physics foundations, hands-on experience, and clear specialization interests. Start by identifying your focus area.
checklist: Research 5-7 top mechanical engineering programs (MIT, Stanford, Cambridge, ETH Zurich, NUS)
Identify your specialization interest (robotics, automotive, aerospace, energy, manufacturing)
Map your current math/physics preparation to program requirements
Write a 3-year roadmap connecting academics, projects, and applications

resources.title: What Top ME Programs Look For

US.overview: US programs emphasize AP/IB rigor, hands-on projects, and research experience. Combine strong academics with practical engineering work.
checklist: Complete AP Physics C (Mechanics) and AP Calculus BC
Research reach, target, and safety schools for mechanical engineering
Identify summer programs (MIT RSI, Stanford SIMR, engineering camps)
Plan your Common App essay theme around engineering passion

UK.overview: UK programs prioritize A-levels, STEP/ENGAA tests, and strong personal statements. Focus on mathematics and physics excellence.
checklist: Review entry requirements for Cambridge, Imperial, Oxford ME programs
Start STEP or ENGAA preparation (Year 12)
Outline UCAS personal statement connecting math/physics to engineering
Research UK engineering accreditation (IMechE)

Asia.overview: Bridge national curricula (JEE, IB, A-levels) with global standards. Emphasize problem-solving and practical skills.
checklist: Review mechanics topics in JEE/IB HL Physics
Identify international engineering competitions (RoboCup, F1 in Schools)
Explore summer programs at NUS, NTU, or international universities
Document your interest in specific ME specializations

quiz.q: Which test is most important for UK mechanical engineering admissions?
What do top US ME programs value most?
opts: Strong academics + hands-on projects + research experience
quiz.correct: Strong academics + hands-on projects + research experience

stages.title: Build Technical Skills & Projects
stages.description: Develop hands-on engineering skills through projects, competitions, and technical coursework.

Global.overview: Demonstrate engineering ability through tangible projects. Build, design, and document your work.
checklist: Complete a hands-on engineering project (robot, vehicle, mechanism)
Learn CAD software (SolidWorks, Fusion 360, AutoCAD)
Document your project with photos, videos, and technical drawings
Participate in an engineering competition or hackathon
projectIdeas: Build a simple robot or robotic arm
Design and 3D print a mechanical device
Create a working prototype (wind turbine, gear system, etc.)
Develop a solution to a real-world problem

US.overview: Link projects to AP Research, science fairs, and summer programs. Show initiative and technical depth.
checklist: Submit project to local/regional science fair or engineering competition
Apply to engineering summer programs (MIT, Stanford, etc.)
Create a portfolio showcasing your projects
Write technical documentation for your work

UK.overview: Integrate projects into EPQ or personal investigations. Connect to university research themes.
checklist: Draft EPQ proposal on mechanical engineering topic
Link project to university course modules
Include project outcomes in UCAS personal statement
Prepare to discuss projects in interviews

Asia.overview: Use national competitions and Olympiads to build standout portfolios.
checklist: Participate in local engineering competitions
Work with a university mentor on a project
Document project in English for international applications
Connect project to global engineering challenges

quiz.q: What's the best way to demonstrate mechanical engineering skills?
opts: Build tangible projects and document them thoroughly
quiz.correct: Build tangible projects and document them thoroughly

stages.title: Strengthen Academic Foundation
stages.description: Excel in mathematics, physics, and engineering-related coursework to demonstrate academic readiness.

Global.overview: Strong math and physics preparation is essential. Focus on calculus, mechanics, and problem-solving.
checklist: Master calculus-based mechanics (kinematics, dynamics, statics)
Complete advanced mathematics (calculus, linear algebra)
Join math/physics competitions or Olympiads
Maintain strong grades in STEM subjects

US.overview: Prioritize AP courses and standardized test preparation.
checklist: Complete AP Physics C: Mechanics and AP Calculus BC
Take SAT Math Level 2 or ACT with strong math score
Consider AP Computer Science for modern ME applications
Participate in USAMO or physics competitions

UK.overview: Excel in A-levels and prepare for STEP/ENGAA assessments.
checklist: Achieve A* in A-level Mathematics and Physics
Solve 5+ past STEP or ENGAA papers
Engage with Isaac Physics challenges
Consider Further Mathematics A-level

Asia.overview: Integrate preparation with national exams while building international readiness.
checklist: Complete JEE-level mechanics and mathematics
Take practice sets from international engineering tests
Maintain strong performance in national exams
Bridge local curriculum to international standards

quiz.q: What academic areas are most critical for mechanical engineering?

stages.title: Craft Your Engineering Narrative
stages.description: Translate your technical skills and projects into compelling application materials.

Global.overview: Connect your engineering passion, projects, and academic achievements into a cohesive story.
checklist: Write a 250-word draft personal statement
Highlight specific projects and their impact
Connect engineering to solving real-world problems
Get feedback from mentors or teachers

US.overview: Focus on Common App essays, recommendations, and activity descriptions.
checklist: Draft Common App essay with engineering focus
Collect 2 strong recommendation letters (preferably from STEM teachers)
Optimize Activities section to highlight projects
Write supplemental essays for engineering schools

UK.overview: Perfect your UCAS statement and prepare for interviews.
checklist: Complete UCAS personal statement drafts
Include technical reading and project work
Prepare for Oxbridge engineering interviews
Practice explaining your projects clearly

Asia.overview: Adapt your narrative for multiple university systems.
checklist: Prepare statements for UCAS and Common App
Gather supporting documents (grades, project portfolios)
Draft reflection on engineering career goals
Translate project documentation to English

quiz.q: What should your engineering personal statement highlight?
opts: Technical passion, hands-on projects, and problem-solving ability
quiz.correct: Technical passion, hands-on projects, and problem-solving ability

stages.title: Final Preparation & Interviews
stages.description: Polish your applications and prepare for interviews and final submissions.

Global.overview: Bring together all your work for confident applications.
checklist: Complete mock interviews focusing on technical questions
Submit all applications before deadlines
Prepare to discuss your projects in detail
Celebrate your engineering journey

US.overview: Rehearse for alumni interviews and finalize applications.
checklist: Conduct mock interview with technical focus
Submit Common App and engineering supplements
Follow up with recommenders
Prepare portfolio presentation if required

UK.overview: Prepare for Oxbridge interviews with problem-solving sessions.
checklist: Review STEP/ENGAA-style interview problems
Practice explaining engineering concepts clearly
Simulate interviews under pressure
Finalize UCAS submission

Asia.overview: Coordinate with international offices and prepare for interviews.
checklist: Confirm all transcripts and project portfolios
Practice interview questions in English
Prepare to discuss your engineering projects
Submit final applications

opts: Clear explanation of projects and problem-solving approach
quiz.correct: Clear explanation of projects and problem-solving approach
